column4: Hi, I have a dual-monitor setup. Once I'm logged in, everything works fine. When usplash shows the loading bar, my smaller monitor says "Out of range".
set the resolution lower for the smaller monitor
how do i do that?
it's only a problem in usplash
it's only a problem in usplash
why are you trying to build that when tilp and tilp2 are in the repos?
I installed tilp2 using APT, but when I run it I get the error
dpkg -l libticables2-1  is it installed?
yes
that's weird.. hey is your calculator arm based?
z80, it's the TI84+SE
i think you might have to be a member of plugdev
type groups and see if you are
i am
does this require a kernel module to be loaded ... like modprobe tilp2 or something  apt-cache show tilp2
there's a tiglusb module, i'll load it now
I do not have a tiglusb module
http://lpg.ticalc.org/prj_usb/linux_install.html
Since I do not have a tiglusb module, how do I install it?
i'm not sure that's the missing element...
look at this http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=912717
that's definately not my problem. He doesn't get any error like mine: "tilp: symbol lookup error: /usr/lib/libticables2.so.1: undefined symbol: usb_debug"
you should /join #ModernCalcs there's only 5 people in there right now but they'd prolly know the answer right off if they are awake
